Initiation tRNA is the first tRNA bound to the ribosome, whereas elongation tRNA is responsible for bringing each successive amino acid to the growing protein chain. EF-Tu recognizes the anticodon of the tRNA and helps the peptidyl transferase complex (PTC) add it to the chain of amino acids. This is an essential step in the translation process and it helps the ribosome discriminate between elongation and initiator tRNAs.
